page.title: 07Public Services
page.content: HANOVER COURT - Hanover Housing Association was founded in 1963. Hanover's aim is to provide housing for the elderly people who are able to lead independent lives or need no more support beyond that which a resident warden can provide. Each flat contains a bedroom,kitchen,bathroom and living room. Each room is equipped with a modern heating system. CARLINGWARK HOUSE - In the building of Carlingwark there are 16 rooms. In the new extension that is being built there will be 30 rooms. There are 32 residents in the whole house. There is a cook and a laundry lady. ABBEYFIELD HOUSE - There are 10 people in the house, including the house-keeper, who is on shift all the time. The people make their own breakfast, but the house-keeper makes their lunch and dinner.
